snippet: Officials in Western Cape Province on Thursday closed 16 schools, affecting 12,000 students, because of a spike in violence that has left teachers too afraid to go to work.
abstract: Education officials in Western Cape Province, South Africa, temporarily close 16 schools, affecting 12,000 students in area near Cape Town, because of spike in gang violence that has left teachers too afraid to go to work.
lead_paragraph: Officials in Western Cape Province on Thursday closed 16 schools, affecting 12,000 students, because of a spike in violence that has left teachers too afraid to go to work.

headline.main: South Africa: 16 Schools Closed Over Fears of Violence by Gangs
